content.title: Promotion Of Intensive Aquaculture Through Introduction Of Bio-floc Technology During The Year 2021-22
content.details: The government of Odisha introduced Bio-floc-based farming and aims to promote sustainable intensification of freshwater fish and brackish water shrimp farming for boosting productivity and generating high income in a limited area. During the current year, 5000 Bio-floc tanks will be developed under this program with subsidy support under the state plan.
eligibility: Farmers interested to take up grow-out tanks, nurseries, and seed tanks; fish and shrimp hatchery operators; private entrepreneurs; unemployed youth.
Eligible brackish water shrimp farms/ nursery and seed tanks/ hatchery beneficiaries must have a concerned license from Coastal Aquaculture Authority.
Support will be in the form of back-ended assistance for the installation of a Bio-floc system inside a shed with PVC/ brick masonry tanks, water supply, drain, and aeration units.
Assistance under the special package will be available to the above categories of beneficiaries with a minimum of 2 tanks and a maximum of 6 tanks.
If a beneficiary has availed subsidy earlier for installation of Bio-floc unit under different schemes, they shall also be eligible to avail further subsidy under this scheme.
documents_required: If a Bank loan is already taken, Consent Letter from Bank
Bank A/C No. with IFS Code for DBT (Photocopy)

faqs.question: What is the objective of the 'Promotion of Intensive Aquaculture through Introduction of Bio-floc Technology' initiative by the government of Odisha?
faqs.answer: The objective is to promote and enhance aquaculture practices through the introduction of bio-floc technology, encouraging sustainable and intensive aquaculture methods.

faqs.question: What is bio-floc technology, and how does it benefit aquaculture practices?
faqs.answer: Bio-floc technology is a sustainable aquaculture approach that utilizes microbial communities to improve water quality and enhance productivity in aquaculture systems.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to participate in the initiative?
faqs.answer: Farmers or individuals engaged in aquaculture activities, including fish or shrimp farmers in specific geographical areas within Odisha.
